title: MSC ship to be based in Cuba
text:
Save 
MSC Cruises is to become the first mainstream cruise line to base a ship in Cuba. 
MSC Opera will have its homeport in Havana for the winter 2015-16 season with a programme of 16 Caribbean cruises. 
Holidaymakers will have the chance to visit the likes of Jamaica, the Cayman Islands and Mexico. 
However, the move means that MSC Opera’s original winter schedule in the Canary Islands, Madeira and Morocco has been cancelled. 
UK guests who have already booked will have the opportunity to get a full refund or transfer their holiday to alternative MSC Cruises Mediterranean itineraries, with the offer of upgrades or on-board credit as compensation. 
Alternatively, guests can switch their booking to Cuba. Fly-cruise customers will be charged a fee of around £285 per person to account for the difference in flight costs. 
The new sailings will be available to UK guests on a cruise-only basis from Thursday July 9. 
Gianni Onorato, chief executive of MSC Cruises, said: “The move to Cuba proves our commitment to offer our guests and holiday-makers the best and most sought-after destinations as they become accessible – thus further enhancing our global offering while providing travellers best-in-class experiences and service.”
